args:
Melsa and Akasha reach the lake where the
sorcerer behind the zombie uprising awaits.
As they prepare an ambush to steal his
grimoire, they are set upon by zombies,
and Akasha is turned into the living dead!
Melsa and Akasha make for the lakeside to steal\nthe necromancy tome away from the man who\nis controlling the zombie horde.
Dear me, Melsa. Are the gentlemen who\noffered themselves as bait still weighing\non your mind? Or is this about Sarisse?
Both—but even more than that, I'm\nthinking about the zombie we met back\nat the castle gates. The one that spoke.
It said ＂hostages＂ and ＂for my family.＂\nWhat does that even MEAN?
I expect the creature retained some\npowerful emotion from when it yet lived.
In the war three hundred years ago,\nthe Empire conscripted those living\nin its lands by force.
It would scarce surprise me if the Empire\ntook some of that zombie's family hostage\nto compel them to fight 'neath its banner.

Thankfully, such captives were generally
released at the war's end and permitted to
become citizens of Alberia, living out the
rest of their days in peace.
But these poor zombies don't know that.\nThey're still fighting against their will.
You look positively forlorn, dear.\nWhat a kind soul you are.
Well here's a riddle to cheer you up:\nI am both deadly weapon\nand fatal weakness. What am I?
A weapon AND a weakness? Hmm...\nSomething that can kill, I suppose...\nKill them with... Ah.
Don't worry—I'm not going to hold back\nwith everyone's lives on the line.
How nice to hear that my concerns\nwere completely unfounded.
We're nearly to the lake now. Let us focus.
Hey, watch it with the boney fingers!\nI said MASSAGE me, not impale me.
*sigh* Are those stupid zombies STILL\nnot done storming the castle?
Sitting back and giving orders is great,\nbut being stuck here waiting is laaaame.
(Look at yon sorcerer there.\nHe carries the Legion Immortalis.)
(If we can take it from him, that should\nstop the zombie invasion.)
(But there are so many of them....\nGetting close is going to be tough.)
(Is this not an opportune time to\nmake use of our cargo, Melsa?)
Did your ears fall off?! I said GENTLE!\nI swear, you'd think a zombie masseuse\nwould be easy to find...
＂Gentle＂ does not mean ＂stop,＂ sludge brain!\n...Huh. That's weird. There's something\ncoming this—CRAP IS THAT A FIREBALL?!
*cough* *sputter* Ugh. Now there's\ngrilled zombie bits all over the place.\nWhat the hell WAS that thing?
Something from the castle armory that I'm\ntold is called a ＂manacaster.＂ A rokkan\nsmith fixed it up enough to fire once.
You're from the Halidom... Rrgh!\nHow did you get here?!
You've no zombies left to save you.\nNow hand over that book.
No way! I braved traps and fiends in\nan ancient burial ground in order to\ntrack this thing down!

These zombies are my ticket up the ladder
to becoming emperor someday—and
believe you me, conquering the Halidom
is gonna look GREAT on my resume.
A truly remarkable portrayal of the classic\ntwo-bit villain. It seems that grimoire is a\nrelic far above your station.
Now be a good boy and do as you're told,\nor I fear we'll have to... Mmm hmm hmm.
Wh-what are you doing?! Hey! S-stay back!\nStay back, stay back, stay baaaack!
Augh! Zombies were hiding in the dirt!

You gotta keep your ace card hidden until
the very last minute! Oh, and that's not
your average animated meat chunk—that
fellow there used to be a COMMANDER!
Akasha, hold on! I'm going to...\nOh no. She's not breathing.
Wait, seriously? She barely got touched.\nStill, if she's gonna go and die that easy,\nthen how can I resist a little...?
＂Kanda d'oom demonis.\n Kanda be'yond cemetaris.\nSwing wide, O gates of hell!＂
Witness the true terror of the Legion\nImmortalis: Each life my army claims\nbecomes its newest pawn!

Oh, and pro tip: This next part is gonna be
a LOT easier if you dispense with all the
screaming and fleeing and whatever
and just agree to help me out.
No! The creatures we blew up are\nalready back on their feet!
See, I'm sure you'd make a passable\nzombie, but this Halidom business is\ntaking WAAAAAY too long.

So I'll make you an offer: Work for me and
convince your old allies to open the gates,
thereby closing the jaws of my incredibly
clever trap right on their tootsies.
Uh, you do realize I command an immortal\narmy of the risen dead here, right?\nI was obvious enough about that?
You guys have zero chance of winning,\nso I feel like my offer to spare your life\nis actually a pretty sweet deal.
I'll not let my friend die.
She believes in me and trusted me\nenough to send me out here.
All manner of people helped me get\nthis far, in fact.
I would sooner die than betray that trust!

This whole ＂power of friendship＂ thing is
SUCH a pain sometimes... But oh well!
You'll just have to be my zombie instead.
...Get her, boys!
Oh, except you, Commander Z.\nYou're still on bodyguard duty.
I won't lose to you when everyone\nis counting on me!
Huh. Not bad. Maybe even decent?\nBut let's see how you fare against my\nnewest recruit.
